title: Resolve frontend build/deploy failure and ensure live marketing site smoke-test readiness

requirements.summary: Fix the frontend production build/deployment failure by removing/repairing missing module imports and stabilizing static asset handling with minimal changes.
acceptanceCriteria: A deployment run that previously failed now completes without errors using the same production/live deployment command/process.
The specific root cause is documented in the PR/commit description (what failed, why, and what changed to fix it).

file_operations.description: Remove/replace imports that can fail production builds due to missing files (e.g., ui toaster module) and ensure the root layout renders without relying on unresolved path aliases.
Replace the unresolved '@/lib/utils' import with a reliable local relative import to a newly added utility module to prevent production build module-resolution failures.

Replace '@/components/ui/button' with a local composed button component (outside immutable ui paths) to eliminate dependency on potentially missing shadcn/ui files and avoid path-alias resolution issues.
Replace '@/components/ui/button' with the local composed button component to ensure consistent build behavior in production.
Replace '@/components/ui/card' imports with a local composed card component to prevent build failures from missing/immutable ui component paths.
Replace '@/components/ui/card' imports with a local composed card component to prevent build failures from missing/immutable ui component paths.
Replace '@/components/ui/card' imports with a local composed card component while preserving the required external links (mailto, X/Twitter, Instagram).
Add a small local Button component (Tailwind-styled) to replace reliance on unresolved shadcn/ui Button imports; keeps changes minimal and avoids editing immutable ui paths.
Add small local Card primitives (Card, CardHeader, CardContent, CardTitle, CardDescription) used by sections to replace unresolved shadcn/ui Card imports; avoids editing immutable ui paths.
Add the missing utility module providing a lightweight className combiner (cn) used by layout components, eliminating a common production build 'module not found' failure.
Ensure the referenced generated asset exists at the public static path to prevent 404s for above-the-fold content in production.
Ensure the referenced generated asset exists at the public static path to prevent missing icon sprite requests in production.
Ensure the referenced generated asset exists at the public static path to prevent missing logo requests in production header/footer.
Add the generated logo asset to the public static folder so it is available if referenced by metadata or future UI usage.
Add a short root-cause note describing the exact failing production build step, the error output, and the minimal frontend changes applied to make deployment succeed.

requirements.summary: Support and validate a post-deploy smoke test of the live marketing page (header/footer render, contact links present, and no critical asset 404s).
acceptanceCriteria: Visiting the live URL loads the marketing page without a blank screen or console-fatal errors.
Header and footer are visible, and the Contact section includes links for email, X/Twitter, and Instagram.
No missing critical static asset requests are observed for above-the-fold content (e.g., logo/hero image requests do not 404).

file_operations.description: Add a lightweight client-side smoke-check helper that can validate presence of key DOM elements (header, footer) and required Contact links, and verify key hero/logo image elements are present to aid live verification.

Wire an optional smoke-check trigger (e.g., guarded behind a query param) that runs after initial render and logs a clear pass/fail summary for header/footer, Contact links (email/X/Instagram), and presence of key above-the-fold images.

Document a short post-deploy smoke test checklist including the exact items required: homepage load, header/footer visible, Contact links (email, X/Twitter, Instagram), and confirming no critical static asset 404s for logo/hero.
